alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 1:24PM PDT until July 08 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northeastern Okanogan County in north central Washington. * WHEN...Until 430 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 123 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in northeastern Okanogan County, including around the Walker Creek burn scar. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wauconda, Bonaparte Lake Campground, Lost Lake Campground, Havillah, Sitzmark Hill, Chesaw and Molson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
